metadata.title: CVE-2022-49011 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:hwmon: (coretemp) fix pci device refcount leak in nv1a_ram_new()As comment of pci_get_domain_bus_and_slot() says, it returnsa pci device with refcount increment, when finish using it,the caller must decrement the reference count by callingpci_dev_put(). So call it after using to avoid refcount leak.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-49011` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-azure - 4.15.0-1162.177~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1162.177~14.04.1').
